text: Is it possible to have the post filter without the number of posts in parenthesis?
Hey, is it possible to have two or three filters for a blog? I know you can have posts  with multiple tags but not sure if in changing a filter to be inclusive as the url slug would say otherwise.,
I dont believe there is a way other than hiding it through CSS
there should be a wrapper on the count with a class called `filter-link-count`

is there anyway to schedule the content staging? For example, push to live on X date? While the content staging is good and all, there really is no big difference in doing this vs just doing all the work with a preview link

There are some advantages to using staging - users can still update the live page and work on it without affecting the staged page.(great for redesigns)

Swapping templates can be hokey if you’re trying to retain the data, if a swap fails it doesn’t always recover properly when using revisions, so the easier route is to just stage the page, swap the template, if it fails, delete the swapped template, make your tweaks try again

I agree a push to live on x date would be good, though I’d kinda want the ability to kick off like an email to the person publishing “Are you sure you’d like to publish” a configurable amount of time in advance.
Anyone out there have experience with A/B testing and a popup form?
trying to figure out how to display different popup forms for different versions of a page

contacting HS support about it - but it’s really annoying this hasn’t been fixed yet.

copying modules to a portal, moving the items out of the folder and deleting it then later copying more modules from the same original portal to that site results in the modules and files floating in outer space. I have reported this bug probably 15 times.

The cause of the problem is how HubSpot stores that a folder was deleted, instead of it actually being deleted it is flagged as deleted, and simply not shown. The copy to portal process does not reflag the folder as not deleted, so it is hidden in the design manager.

oh goodie… because this portal is a sandbox/dev portal I can’t contact support… if any :sprocket:  peeps can assist it would be appreciated. *Edit: Solved my problem by manually copying the module over via FTP. I think I likely still have a ghost version of the module but this atleast lets me get back to work.*
do the same rules apply for applying js to a form when it is on a different cms?  do i need to wait for the window to fully load?
are logos cached for a longer period of time than other assets?
Yeah I would expect you'd still need to run your JS within a `window.onload` function, if trying to target embedded HS forms.

that is what i am doing.  this site is needlessly heavy so it is taking a bit for everything to load which leaves my form blowing in the wind while it waits...all for some select dropdown styles :disappointed:

hmm, yeah I can see how that would make the `window.onload` approach more of a roadblock...Another idea would be to use `setTimeout` to trigger your function after a set amount of time (ie after the form loads, but before the rest of the page.)
Still have lots to learn in the JS world, so there may be other methods at your disposal...
I am going to use the onformready.  Will see how it works. Thanks for the thoughts!
